chargeHist.descr: Battery to Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens
Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker

result.execSummary:
The defendant Leila Onofre Horowitz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Leila Onofre Horowitz is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Leila Onofre Horowitz was found guilty of Battery to Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(2).
  • Leila Onofre Horowitz was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Leila Onofre Horowitz was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Judgment in favor of victim for unpaid restitution.

parties.name: Pepin County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
1) The defendant will have no further contacts w/law enforcement during term of agrmt. that give rise to probable cause for arrest due to criminal conduct.
2)Defendant shall notify Pepin County District Attorney's Office of any change of residence or employment.
3)One month prior to completion of contract, defendant must contact Pepin County District Attorney's Office for a final interview.
4)Report in person as requested by the Pepin County District Attorney or other supervisor designated by him.
5) The defendant must follow the rules and regulations as set forth by probation, if applicable.
ADDITIONAL CONDITIONS:
A.  I will not possess or consume alcohol at any time for the duration of this agreement.
B.  I consent to random PBT tests and/or urinalysis at any time as directed by the DA's office or any law enforcement officer.  Refusal to take such tests as directed will be considered a violation of this agreement.
C.  I will continue counseling.
D.  I will take any/all medications as prescribed.  I will not discontinue any medication w/o my physician's approval.

supervisions.notes:
Serve 180 days in the Pepin County Jail with 136 days credit.  Huber privileges granted.
Concurrent with: Pepin County Case No. 2017CM35

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leila Onofre Horowitz

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Completion by SPD

Defendant Leila Onofre Horowitz in court with attorney Steven Hughes.  Defendant Leila Onofre Horowitz in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Here on sentencing after revocation in 17CM35, sentencing on revoked DPA count 1 in 16CF17, STC in 18CM08.  Parties reached a partial agreement, argue sentencing.  Agreement on new case, she will plead to resisting an officer, DRI disorderly conduct and argue sentence.  Court advises defendant of charge in count 1 of 18CM08/max. penalties.  Defendant enters a plea of guilty.  PLQ/WOR form filed with the court and reviewed with defendant. Court finds defendant's waiver of her constitutional rights and plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty of count 1 in 18CM08, dismiss count 2.  State confirms complied with victim notification requirements and informs there are no further victim impact statements.  Court informs counsel has read Ms. Smith's statement from Mr. Hughes.  No other statements by counsel.  Closing arguments by State, recomend 9 mos. in the PCJ concurrent on all 3 cases.  Court to avoid complicated sentence credit confirms days credit with counsel; on probation revocation case, sentence to 100 days in the PCJ with 80 days credit; on count 1 in 16CF17, sentence to 180 days with 136 days credit; count 1 in 18CM08, sentence to 120 days in the PCJ consecutive to 16CF17 and 17CM35 and any other sentence with no sentence credit with huber privileges and grant judgment for any unpaid costs; waive costs in 18CM08 and other case.  Advised of appeal rights.
Letter of Support of Defendant
Status conference on May 15, 2018 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on June 19, 2018 at 03:30 pm.
Count 1

Defendant Leila Onofre Horowitz in court with attorney Steven Hughes.  Defendant Leila Onofre Horowitz in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court informs receipt of a letter from Ms. Horowitz.  State confirms received letter and reviewed it.  Defendant currently on PO Hold; scheduled for revocation hearing on 5/30 which is disputed.  State's motion to revoke based on her consumption of alcohol and alleged violation of criminal law includes new filing in 18CM08; court previously declined to revoke DPA.  Atty Hughes informs his client is asking court not revoke DPA.  Court informs DPA not working, demonstrated inability to comply, find violation material and new threat to law enforcement and revoke DPA.  Counsel does not request PSI.  P&P Agent informs she was previously revoked on misdemeanor and then placed back on probation on another case where she is now being revoked.  State requests $1000 cash bond.  Court sets $1000 cash bond in 16CF17 count 1 so she will get credit.  In 18CM08 NGP entered.  STC set in 16CF17 count 1 and 18CM08 for 6/5 at 3:30 p.m.  Status conference scheduled for June 5, 2018 at 03:30 pm.
Letter from defendant
Motion hearing on April 3, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
Atty Steven Hughes appt'd.
Motion hearing on March 26, 2018 at 01:15 pm.
Motion to Revoke DAGP
Notice of Case Closing by SPD

Defendant Leila Onofre Horowitz in court with attorney Steven Hughes.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached.  Defendant will plead on new charge of D.C. with joint sentence recom. of 2 days jail and ask no court costs due to financial hardship, State will not seek to revoke the DPA in 16CF17.  Court advises defendant of D.C. charge/max penalties.  Defendant enters plea of guilty.  PLQ/WOR form filed with the court and reviewed with defendant. Court advises defendant if not a citizen of the US, a plea of guilty or no contest may result in deportation under federal law. Court finds defendant's waiver of her constitutional rights and plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty.  State confirms complied with victim notification requirements and informs there are no victim impact statements.  Closing arguments.  Court sentences defendant to 15 days in the PCJ with credit for 10 days, leaves you 2 days to serve with good time; commence 12/15 at 8:00 p.m. w/huber privileges; law says have to order costs, assess $443.00 at pay at rate of $100/mo. com. 4/1/17; show withdrawal of motion for revocation of DPA; advised of appeal rights.

Court advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and charge in Deferred Prosecution status for felony battery charge to law enforcement officer and DA filed motion to revoke that agreement. State requests Court consider revocation and sentence on the felony.  Atty Loberg informs Defendant agrees violation of provision A of the agreement, informs Court of steps she has taken with treatment, etc. and ask the Court to modify condition and give her another chance.  DOC agent informs defendant was on a PO Hold from 8/23-8/29 and released into Arbor Place.  Court denies request to revoke, motion denied.

Defendant Leila Onofre Horowitz in court with attorney Jens Hubert Loberg.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached, joint recommendation, argue jail.  16CF17 Count 1 DAGPA; Counts 3 & 4 2 yrs. probation; Counts 2 & 5 dismiss; 16CF20 dismiss; 2 traffic citations, plead to guidelines @ .12-.149.  Court advises defendant of charges in count 3 & 4/max. penalties; count 1/max penalties; advised of felony prohibitions; review DPA. Defendant pleads guilty to OWI; pleads guilty to Count 3; guilty to Count 4; subject to DPA in Count 1 pleads guilty.  Plea Colloquy. Court advises defendant of criminal conviction can result in immigration consequences.  Court finds defendant's waiver of her constitutional rights & plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts pleas and finds defendant guilty of OWI; Count 3, Count 4, approve DPA in Count 1; dismiss but consider as read-in 16CF20; withhold sentence and place on 2 yrs probation with conditions; OWI assess $937.50; 6 mos. revoc.; AA/DSP; stipulate refusal reasonable and dismiss; Advised of appeal rights.
Status conference on July 5, 2016 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Leila Onofre Horowitz in court with attorney Jens Hubert Loberg.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In negotations, schedule @ 60 days out. State requests matter be scheduled sooner.  Status conference scheduled for July 5, 2016 at 08:45 am.
Status conference on May 23, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Information filed by the State.

Defendant Leila Onofre Horowitz in court with attorney Jens Hubert Loberg.  Defendant Leila Onofre Horowitz in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court provides counsel and defendant with a copy of the Information; advises defendant of charge, maximum penalties.  Court with the consent of counsel and defendant uses the complaint in 16CF17 with the DA to supplement the record with the Information.  State informs of amendment to count 2 from expel urine to expel saliva.  Court advises defendant of charges/max penalties and advises defendant of her constitutional rights.  NGP entered all cases, all charges.  Atty Loberg addressed bond in 16CF20, requests reduced cash bond or convert to Signature Bond.  State notes safest place for Ms. Horowitz is where she is.  Court modifies bond to be $5000 cash or $5000 signature with conditions:  stay out of trouble; no drinking; monitored sobriety with twice a day testing; comply with treatment program; reside with Melissa Smith.

Defendant Leila Onofre Horowitz in court with attorney Jens Hubert Loberg.  Defendant Leila Onofre Horowitz in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to a prelim. hrg. on record.  Court finds defendant's waiver of preliminary hearing done knowingly & voluntarily, binds defendant over for trial and accept Information for filing.  Atty Loberg notes their WOPH noted both cases 16CF20 and 16CF17.  Court shows WOPH on both cases.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
Jens H. Loberg has been retained by the defendant, in the above-reference matter.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 10, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Leila Onofre Horowitz in court with attorney Gary E. Smith.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Smith requests to be heard on bond before addressing preliminary hearing.  State informs 16CF17 court set $5000 signature bond, 2nd case 16CF20 court set $5000 cash bond and left the $5000 signature bond on 1st case.  State doesn't object to reduced bond amount if conditions set to protect the public 1)defendant on alcohol monitor; 2)defendant remain faithful in treatment or counseling having now; best place is in jail on $5000 cash bond.  Atty Smith requests signature bond, cash bond not warranted.  Court notes the violation of signature bond, she was drinking, charged with OWI and felony bail jumping.  Bond remains as previously set.  Advised of right to P.H.  Defendant requests P.H. on 2nd case.  Counsel referred to scheduling clerk to schedule P.H. within 10 days.

Attorney Gary E. Smith in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant FTA.  Atty Smith informs the court his office received a call from her saying she was in the hospital.  Warrant requested by the State.  Court authorizes warrant unless counsel can get verification she was in hospital.
Atty Gary Smith appt'd.
